attributes.action: A price cap on football season tickets
attributes.additional_details: There needs to be a price cap, countries like Germany aren't charging fans astronomical prices to watch football, where as UK clubs are milking us dry of money. The Premier league has one of the biggest TV deals in history but yet teams like Chelsea are set to triple season tickets in certain parts of the stadium which could cost up too £3900, that works out at about £205 for 19 Premier league home matches
attributes.background: There ever rising costs of football season tickets is getting out of hand, especially in the Premier league.

rejection.details:
Decisions about the cost of football tickets are a matter for individual football clubs, not the UK Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.
